div.l: Of corn̄ be sleight or by force hem tene
And atte last the last the warden ȝaf hem leve
Iohn hight the tone and Aleyn̄ hat the tothir͗e
Of a Town̄ wer͗e þey bore þat hiȝte strothir
Fer͗e in the North I can nat tel ȝowe wher͗e
The makyn̄ redy al her own̄ gere
And on her hors the sakkiss cast anon̄
Forth goith Aleyn̄ þe Clerk ⁊and eke Iohn
With swerd and bokeler right by her side
Iohn knewe the wey hym nedith no guyd
And atte myl adown̄ the sak he leyith
Alayn̄ spak first alhayle Symond in feith
Howe faris thy feir͗e doghter and þy wyfe
Aleyn welcom quod Symkyn̄ be my lyfe
And Iohn also what howe what do yee here
Symond qduod Iohn be God ned nas no pier͗e
Hym bus serve hym̄ self that is no sweyn̄
Or ellis he is afool as Clerkes seyn̄
Our͗e Mauncipil I hope he wol be dede
Swa workis ay there wangis in his hede
And þ̉erfor I is com and dis Aleyn̄
To grynd our͗e Corn̄ and cary it home ageyn̄
I prey ȝowe spede ȝowe hen̄ þat yee may
Hit shal be do quod Symkyn̄ be my fay
What wol ȝee do while it is in hond
Be god right be the heper wol I stond
Quod Iohn and se howe the corn̄ gois In̄
Ȝet saw I nevir be my fadir kyn̄
Howe the hoper waggis to and froo
Aleyn̄ answerd Iohn wolt þowe so
Than wol I be beneth be my croun̄
And se howe þat þe mele fallis a doun̄
In to the trowȝe that shal be my disport
For Iohn in fayith I may be of your͗e sort
Ay is as il a myller as is ye
This Miller smylith at her nycete
